Ingest_LDD.name: LRO
Ingest_LDD.comment: The LRO dictionary contains classes that describe aspects of the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter mission and related instruments.

DD_Attribute.name: a_axis_radius
DD_Attribute.definition: The a_axis_radius attribute provides the radius of the equatorial axis of the ellipsoid. The IAU calls this "Subplanetary equatorial radius" and mapping applications generally call this "semi_major_axis".
DD_Attribute.comment: In PDS3 this was named A_AXIS_RADIUS.

DD_Attribute.name: azimuth_beamwidth
DD_Attribute.definition: The null to null main lobe beam pattern beamwidth in azimuth direction.

DD_Attribute.name: azimuth_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The true resolution of the radar image in the azimuth (along track) direction, evaluated at the center of the image for the transmit, receive, and processing parameters used for the sequence.

DD_Attribute.name: b_axis_radius
DD_Attribute.definition: The b_axis_radius attribute provides the value of the intermediate axis of the ellipsoid that defines the approximate shape of a target body. The b_axis_radius is usually in the equatorial plane. The IAU calls this axis "along orbit equatorial radius". Mapping applications, which generally only define a sphere or an ellipse, do not support this radius parameter.
DD_Attribute.comment: In PDS3 this was named B_AXIS_RADIUS.

DD_Attribute.name: background_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: The background offset

DD_Attribute.name: band_code
DD_Attribute.definition: The band_code records the commanded band code for a WAC observation.

DD_Attribute.name: band_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The band_description contains a description of a specific band in a MiniRF multibanded 3D image

DD_Attribute.name: band_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The band_name contains a string identifying the common name for a specific band in a MiniRF multibanded 3D image

DD_Attribute.name: band_sequence_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The band_sequence_number records the index for a specific band in a MiniRF multibanded 3D image. Index starts at 1

DD_Attribute.name: begin_temperature_fpa
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC FPA in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts, at the beginning of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: begin_temperature_fpa_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC (F)ocal (P)lane (A)rray at the beginning of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: begin_temperature_scs
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC SCS in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts, at the beginning of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: begin_temperature_scs_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC SCS at the beginning of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: bterm1
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding bterm 1

DD_Attribute.name: bterm2
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding bterm 2

DD_Attribute.name: bterm3
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding bterm 3

DD_Attribute.name: bterm4
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding bterm 4

DD_Attribute.name: bterm5
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding bterm 5

DD_Attribute.name: c_axis_radius
DD_Attribute.definition: The c_axis_radius attribute provides the value of the polar axis of the ellipsoid that defines the approximate shape of a target body. The c_axis_radius is normal to the plane defined by the a_axis_radius and b_axis_radius. The IAU calls this "polar radius". Mapping applications generally call this "semi_minor_axis"
DD_Attribute.comment: In PDS3 this was named C_AXIS_RADIUS.

DD_Attribute.name: calibration_software_ver_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The version of calibration software used to generate a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: center_frequency
DD_Attribute.definition: The center frequency

DD_Attribute.name: channel
DD_Attribute.definition: One of nine Diviner channels.

DD_Attribute.name: channel_a_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded NAC channel A offset for either the NAC LEFT or NAC RIGHT.

DD_Attribute.name: channel_b_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded NAC channel B offset for either the NAC LEFT or NAC RIGHT.

DD_Attribute.name: chirp_bandwidth
DD_Attribute.definition: bandwidth of the chirp signal (max frequency - min frequency). chirp_rate is chip_bandwidth/pulse_width.

DD_Attribute.name: chirp_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: Chirp rate in Hz/sec.

DD_Attribute.name: chirp_sample_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: sampling frequency of the chirp signal.

DD_Attribute.name: chirp_start_frequency
DD_Attribute.definition: Starting frequency of the chirp signal.

DD_Attribute.name: compand_code
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates which stored companding table was used (0-7)

DD_Attribute.name: complete_lines
DD_Attribute.definition: The number of lines of data in a data product that are complete; that is, with no missing data.

DD_Attribute.name: compression_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates if lossless compression was commanded (0=no, 1=yes)

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_system_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The given name of the used coordinate system. e.g. "MEAN EARTH/POLAR AXIS OF DE421"

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_system_type
DD_Attribute.definition:
There are three basic types of coordinate systems: body-fixed rotating, body-fixed non-rotating, and inertial. A body-fixed coordinate system is one associated with the body (e.g., a planet or satellite). The body-fixed system is centered on the body and rotates with the body (unless it is a non-rotating type), whereas an inertial coordinate system is fixed at some point in space.
Currently, the PDS has specifically defined two types of body-fixed rotating coordinate systems: planetocentric and planetographic. However, the set of related data elements are modeled such that definitions for other body-fixed rotating coordinate systems, body-fixed non-rotating and inertial coordinate systems can be added as the need arises. Contact a PDS data engineer for assistance in defining a specific coordinate system.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The PDS has specifically defined two types of body-fixed rotating coordinate systems: planetocentric and planetographic.
The body-fixed system is centered on the body and it is non-rotating
an inertial coordinate system is fixed at some point in space.

DD_Attribute.name: dac_reset_level
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded DAC reset level for either the NAC LEFT or NAC RIGHT.

DD_Attribute.name: data_quality_desc
DD_Attribute.definition: The data_quality_desc attribute describes the data qualities associated with a data_quality_id attribute.

DD_Attribute.name: data_quality_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The data_quality_id attribute provides a numeric key which identifies the quality of data available for a particular time period. The data_quality_id scheme is unique to a given instrument and is described by the associated data_quality_desc attribute.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_date_max
DD_Attribute.definition: Gives the maximum recorded date value in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: Gives the maximum recorded date value in a DLRE RDR data product. The format is DD-MMM-YYYY.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_date_min
DD_Attribute.definition: Gives the minimum recorded date value in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: Gives the minimum recorded date value in a DLRE RDR data product. The format is DD-MMM-YYYY.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_geom_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The version of Diviner geometry and averaging software used to generate a Diviner GDR product. Example value: 1.0.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_instrument_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Diviner instrument operating mode.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_orientation
DD_Attribute.definition: An unordered set of all orientations recorded from activity flags in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_utc_max
DD_Attribute.definition: Gives the maximum recorded UTC value in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: Gives the maximum recorded UTC value in a DLRE RDR data product. The format is HH-MM-SS.sss.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_utc_min
DD_Attribute.definition: Gives the minimum recorded UTC value in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: Gives the minimum recorded UTC value in a DLRE RDR data product. The format is HH-MM-SS.sss.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_wavelength_max
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the maximum wavelength at which an observation can be made or was made.

DD_Attribute.name: dlre_wavelength_min
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the minimum wavelength at which an observation can be made or was made.

DD_Attribute.name: dreb_flight_software_ver_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The version of Diviner Remote Electronics Box flight software used to acquire the telemetry data for a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: end_temperature_fpa
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC FPA in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts, at the end of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: end_temperature_fpa_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC (F)ocal (P)lane (A)rray at the end of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: end_temperature_scs
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC SCS in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts, at the end of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: end_temperature_scs_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC SCS at the end of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_code
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded exposure code for a WAC observation.

DD_Attribute.name: file_state
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates whether a file possibly contains potentially corrupted data.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: A CLEAN file may still contain missing or partial records, as long as all available records are written successfully.
DIRTY means only that the file was prematurely closed during output, e.g. during a program crash.

DD_Attribute.name: flight_software_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the version of the instrument flight software used to acquire the data.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_id
DD_Attribute.definition: For NAC, records if the image was acquired from the "LEFT" or "RIGHT" NAC.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The image was acquired from the LEFT NAC.
The image was acquired from the RIGHT NAC.

DD_Attribute.name: grid_resolution_height
DD_Attribute.definition: vertical resolution of the grid used to generate the bistatic raw sar data.

DD_Attribute.name: grid_resolution_width
DD_Attribute.definition: horizontal resolution of the grid used to generate the bistatic raw sar data.

DD_Attribute.name: ground_station
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the ground station used as the transmitter in Mini-RF bistatic operations.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The S-band transmitter at Arecibo Observatory in Puerto Rico.
The X-band transmitter at DSS-13 ground station in Venus, California.

DD_Attribute.name: image_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the name of the parameter stored in the Diviner image.

DD_Attribute.name: instrument_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded WAC mode: BW, COLOR, VIS or UV.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The commanded WAC instrument mode was BW.
The commanded WAC instrument mode was COLOR.
The commanded WAC instrument mode was VIS.
The commanded WAC instrument mode was UV.

DD_Attribute.name: interframe_delay
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the value of the interframe delay between WAC framelets. Keyword can have values between 25/64 and 280/64 seconds, in 1/64 seconds increments.

DD_Attribute.name: interframe_gap_code
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded interframe gap code for a WAC observation.

DD_Attribute.name: latitude_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The latitude_type attribute defines the type of latitude (planetographic, planetocentric) used within a cartographic product and as reflected in attribute values within associated PDS labels. For planets and satellites, latitude is measured north and south of the equator; north latitudes are designated as positive. The planetocentric latitude is the angle between the equatorial plane and a line from the center of the body. The planetographic latitude is the angle between the equatorial plane and a line that is normal to the body. In summary, both latitudes are equivalent on a sphere (i.e., equatorial radius equal to polar radius); however, they differ on an ellipsoid (e.g., Mars, Earth). For more on latitude_type, please see the IAU publication available here: http://astrogeology.usgs.gov/groups/IAU-WGCCRE

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The planetographic latitude is the angle between the equatorial plane and a line that is normal to the body.
The planetocentric latitude is the angle between the equatorial plane and a line from the center of the body.

DD_Attribute.name: line_code
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded value for the number of NAC lines to acquire, in 1024 increments. (LINES = LINES_CODE * 1024)

DD_Attribute.name: line_exposure_code
DD_Attribute.definition: Index range from 0 to 4095 each corresponding to one LINE_EXPOSURE_DURATION increment.

DD_Attribute.name: line_exposure_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: For NAC products, LINE_EXPOSURE_DURATION can have values between 337.6 and 35,281.6 microseconds, in 128/15 microsecond increments (LINE_EXPOSURE_DURATION = [LINE_EXPOSURE_CODE * 128/15] + 337.6)

DD_Attribute.name: lola_dem_vers
DD_Attribute.definition: Gives the version of the LOLA digital elevation model that was used to locate Diviner footprints for the generation of a Diviner GDR product. Example value: 1.0.

DD_Attribute.name: lola_instrument_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: LOLA instrument operating mode.

DD_Attribute.name: longitude_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The longitude_direction attribute identifies the direction of longitude (e.g. POSITIVE_EAST or POSITIVE_WEST) for a planet. The IAU definition for direction of positive longitude should be adopted: http://astrogeology.usgs.gov/groups/IAU-WGCCRE. Typically, for planets with prograde (direct) rotations, positive longitude direction is to the west. For planets with retrograde rotations, positive longitude direction is to the east. Generally the Positive West longitude_direction is used for planetographic systems and Positive East is used for planetocentric systems. If the data is defined with Spatial_Domain in a manner not recommended by the IAU, there is a optional Secondary_Spatial_Domain section to define a second set of bounding coordinates.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Positive East longitudes (i.e., longitudes measured positively to the east) will be used when the bodies rotation is retrograde. Because of tradition, the Earth, Sun, and Moon do not conform with this definition. Their rotations are direct and longitudes run both east and west 180 degree, or east 360 degree.
Positive West longitudes (i.e., longitudes measured positively to the west) will be used when the rotation is prograde (direct).

DD_Attribute.name: look_azimuth_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The East-West look azimuth discrimination angle. This is the angle between the projection of North into the tangent plane of a sphere at the image center point and the vector from subspacecraft point to the image center projected into the plane. It assumes values from 0 to 360, where 0 means North-looking, 90 East-looking, 180 South-looking, and 270 West-looking.

DD_Attribute.name: lookup_table_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Always set to STORED.

DD_Attribute.name: middle_temperature_fpa
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC FPA in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts, at the middle of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: middle_temperature_fpa_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC (F)ocal (P)lane (A)rray at the middle of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: middle_temperature_scs
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC SCS in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts, at the middle of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: middle_temperature_scs_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC SCS at the middle of a series of WAC frames.

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The mission_phase_name attribute provides the mission-defined name of a time period within the mission.

DD_Attribute.name: missing_lines
DD_Attribute.definition: The total number of lines of data missing from an image or observation when it was received on Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: mode
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the mode value as commanded for both NAC and WAC observations.

DD_Attribute.name: mterm1
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding mterm 1

DD_Attribute.name: mterm2
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding mterm 2

DD_Attribute.name: mterm3
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding mterm 3

DD_Attribute.name: mterm4
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding mterm 4

DD_Attribute.name: mterm5
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding mterm 5

DD_Attribute.name: nframes
DD_Attribute.definition: Records the commanded number of frames for a WAC observation.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the general type of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The orbit_number attribute identifies the number of the orbital revolution around a target body.

DD_Attribute.name: parameter_max
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum value for the Diviner parameter specified by lro.parameter_name.

DD_Attribute.name: parameter_min
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum value for the Diviner parameter specified by lro.parameter_name.

DD_Attribute.name: parameter_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Diviner parameter name.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The recorded Julian date value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded orbit number value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded sun distance value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded sun latitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded sun longitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded spacecraft clock value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded spacecraft latitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded spacecraft longitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded spacecraft radius value (distance from center of moon to spacecraft) in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded spacecraft altitude value (distance from surface of moon to spacecraft) in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded last elevation command value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded last azimuth command value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded orientation latitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded orientation longitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded value of the X component of the Diviner Look Unit Vector in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded value of the Y component of the Diviner Look Unit Vector in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded value of the Z component of the Diviner Look Unit Vector in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded FOV center latitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded FOV center longitude value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded FOV center emission angle value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded FOV center solar zenith angle value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded FOV center solar azimuth angle value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded local time at FOV center in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded solar calibration quality flag value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded thermal calibration quality flag value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded geometry quality flag value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The recorded miscellaneous quality flag value in a DLRE RDR data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument A1 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument A2 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument A3 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument A4 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument A5 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument A6 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument B1 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument B2 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the Diviner instrument B3 detector channel in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the last azimuth command in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.
The value of the last elevation command in the set of observations that make up a Diviner data product.

DD_Attribute.name: partial_lines
DD_Attribute.definition: The number of lines of data in a data product that contain partial but incomplete data.

DD_Attribute.name: preroll_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The UTC time and date at the start of the image acquisition command, corresponding to the acquisition of 1024 lines at the given exposure prior to the actual image acquisition.

DD_Attribute.name: producer_full_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_full_name attribute provides the full_name of the individual mainly responsible for the production of a data set.

DD_Attribute.name: producer_institution_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_institution_name attribute identifies a university, research center, NASA center, or other institution associated with the production of a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: product_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_type attribute indicates the processing level of an individual data product.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: LEND Experiment Data Record housekeeping data.
LEND Experiment Data Record science data.
LEND Reduced Data Record averaged counts data.
LEND Reduced Data Record converted housekeeping data.
LEND Reduced Data Record derived data.
LEND Reduced Data Record extended derived data.
LEND Reduced Data Record rectified science data.
LOLA Gridded Data Record - albedo counts.
LOLA Gridded Data Record - topography counts.
LOLA Gridded Data Record - digital elevation model.
LOLA Gridded Data Record - surface roughness counts.
LOLA Gridded Data Record - surface roughness.
LOLA Gridded Data Record - surface slope.
LOLA Gridded Data Record - albedo map.

DD_Attribute.name: product_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_version_id attribute identifies the version of an individual data product.

DD_Attribute.name: pulse_repitition_interval
DD_Attribute.definition: Pulse repitition interval of the signal from the transmitter for Mini-RF bistatic operations.

DD_Attribute.name: pulse_width
DD_Attribute.definition: duration of the chirp pulse.

DD_Attribute.name: radiance_max
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum recorded value of radiance for the channel given by lro:channel in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Attribute.name: radiance_min
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum recorded value of radiance for the channel given by lro:channel in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Attribute.name: range_beamwidth
DD_Attribute.definition: The null to null main lobe beam pattern beamwidth along the range direction.

DD_Attribute.name: range_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The true resolution of the radar image in the range (across track) direction, evaluated at the center of the image for the transmit, receive, and processing parameters used for the sequence.

DD_Attribute.name: rationale_desc
DD_Attribute.definition: The rationale_desc attribute describes the rationale for performing a particular observation.

DD_Attribute.name: sar_emission_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: Emission angle for SAR

DD_Attribute.name: sar_incidence_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The angle between the normal to the lunar surface (body radius based on a digital elevation model or DEM) and the vector to the Earth-based transmitter.

DD_Attribute.name: sar_instrument_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Mini-RF SAR instrument operating mode.

DD_Attribute.name: sar_phase_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The angle between the SAR (Mini-RF) receiver and the Earth-based transmitter. It is also known as the bistatic angle.

DD_Attribute.name: software_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The software_version_id element indicates the version (development level) of a program or a program library.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_count_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_count_partition attribute indicates the clock partition active for the spacecraft_clock_start_count and spacecraft_clock_stop_count attributes.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_preroll_count
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the sclk string for the start of an observation preroll acquisition.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_start_count attribute provides the value of the spacecraft clock at the beginning of a time period of interest.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_stop_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_stop_count attribute provides the value of the spacecraft clock at the beginning of a time period of interest.

DD_Attribute.name: start_orbit_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides the the lowest revolution orbit number that contributed data to a given data product.

DD_Attribute.name: start_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Marks the beginning of a time range measured in solar longitude. Solar longitude is the value of the angle between the body_Sun line at the time of interest and the body_Sun line at the vernal equinox, thus providing a measure of the season on the target body.

DD_Attribute.name: stcf_file_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides the name of the LRO Spacecraft Time Correlation file, which is a housekeeping file containing the offset between the spacecraft raw clock and terrestrial time. The time correlation file is used to compute the start and stop spacecraft clock times for LOLA data products.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_orbit_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides the the highest revolution orbit number that contributed data to a given data product.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Marks the end of a time range measured in solar longitude. Solar longitude is the value of the angle between the body_Sun line at the time of interest and the body_Sun line at the vernal equinox, thus providing a measure of the season on the target body.

DD_Attribute.name: sub_spacecraft_ground_azimuth
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides the value of the angle, measured on the target body surface, between the direction from a ground point to the north pole and the direction from the ground point to the sub-spacecraft point. If the location of the ground point at which the azimuth is measured is not otherwise specified, it is assumed to correspond to the center of the image. The values of this angle increase in a clockwise direction. When a pair of values is given, e.g. (350.0, 10.0), they represent the ordered end-members of a range of ground azimuth values that extends clockwise from the first to the second, modulo 360 degrees.

DD_Attribute.name: tb_max
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum recorded value of brightness temperature for the channel given by lro:channel in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Attribute.name: tb_min
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum recorded value of brightness temperature for the channel given by lro:channel in a DLRE RDR data product.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_fpa
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC FPA in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_fpa_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC (F)ocal (P)lane (A)rray.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_fpga
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC FPGA in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_fpga_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC (F)ield (P)rogrammable (G)ate (A)rray.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_scs
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC SCS in degrees Celsius, as converted from the raw engineering counts.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_scs_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC SCS.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_telescope
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the temperature of the LROC telescope corresponding to NAC-L or NAC-R, as converted from the raw engineering counts.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_telescope_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: Set to the raw engineering counts for the LROC Telescope corresponding to NAC-L or NAC-R.

DD_Attribute.name: total_lines
DD_Attribute.definition: The total number of lines of data in a data product, including both complete lines and partial lines.

DD_Attribute.name: upload_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The upload_id attribute describes a spacecraft command set that is associated with the given data product.

DD_Attribute.name: xterm1
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding xterm 1

DD_Attribute.name: xterm2
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding xterm 2

DD_Attribute.name: xterm3
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding xterm 3

DD_Attribute.name: xterm4
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding xterm 4

DD_Attribute.name: xterm5
DD_Attribute.definition: NAC companding xterm 5

DD_Class.name: LROC_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The LROC_Parameters class is the container for LROC-specific observation parameters.

DD_Class.name: Parameter_Range
DD_Class.definition: The Parameter_Range class contains the minimum and maximum values of Diviner parameters.

DD_Class.name: Channel_Range
DD_Class.definition: The Channel_Range class contains spectral parameters for specific Diviner channels.

DD_Class.name: MiniRF_Band
DD_Class.definition: The MiniRF_Band class contains the name and description for a specific band in a MiniRF Array_3D_Image

DD_Class.name: Diviner_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Diviner_Parameters class is the container for Diviner-specific observation parameters.

DD_Class.name: MiniRF_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The MiniRF_Parameters class is the container for MiniRF-specific observation parameters.

DD_Class.name: LOLA_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The LOLA_Parameters class is the container for LOLA-specific observation parameters.

DD_Class.name: Geodetic_Model
DD_Class.definition: The Geodetic_Model class provides parameters describing the shape of the planet.

DD_Class.name: LRO_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The LRO_Parameters class is the container for mission-specific metadata elements.
